CVE.summary: Mozilla Firefox before 3.6.18 and 4.x through 4.0.1, Thunderbird before 3.1.11, and SeaMonkey through 2.0.14 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory corruption and application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via a multipart/x-mixed-replace image.

CWE.title: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer

Oval.title: ELSA-2011:0885: firefox security and bug fix update (Critical)
RHSA-2011:0885: firefox security and bug fix update (Critical)

Mozilla Firefox before 3.6.18 and 4.x through 4.0.1, Thunderbird before 3.1.11, and SeaMonkey through 2.0.14 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory corruption and application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via a multipart/x-mixed-replace image.
